I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Zrec4 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : nat, and_recZ p P

Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z

nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
ssrbool.prop_in1 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop

plus_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n + p <= m + p
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ

BinInt.Z.add_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add n (BinInt.Z.add m p) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n m) p
BinInt.Z.mul_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n (BinInt.Z.mul m p) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.mul n m) p

Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m

Nat.add_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> n + p <= m + p

gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
lt_minus2 : forall n m : nat, n < m -> 0 < m - n
tech_pos_not_posZ : forall n m : nat, n <> m -> pos n <> pos m

Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
